H0.text: who fought in the gulf war 1991. United States

H1.text: who fought in the gulf war 1991. Saudi Arabia

H2.text: who fought in the gulf war 1991. Kuwait

H3.text: who fought in the gulf war 1991. Iraq

A4.text: The bulk of the coalition's military power was from the United States, with Saudi Arabia, the United Kingdom, and Egypt as the largest lead-up contributors, in that order.

A5.text: Iraq, governed by Saddam Hussein, invaded neighboring Kuwait and fully occupied the country within two days.

A6.text: General Schwarzkopf was the coalition commander in the Persian Gulf War

A7.text: United States Marine Corps liberated Kuwait
